episodeTitle: Luffy Cuts Through! Big Showdown on the Judicial Island!
episodeTitleJapanese: ルフィ快進撃！司法の島で大決戦！！
episodeTitleRomanized: Rufi Kaishingeki! Shihō no Shima de Daikessen!!
description: Luffy charges into Enies Lobby alone, using creative tactics to overwhelm the Marines at the main gate. Meanwhile, the Franky Family and Galley-La Company shipwrights launch their assault, breaking through the front gates. They encounter two giant gatekeepers, Kashii and Oimo, who have been guarding Enies Lobby for 50 years after being tricked by the World Government.

events.title: Luffy's Solo Assault on Enies Lobby Begins
events.description: Luffy charges into Enies Lobby alone, bypassing thousands of Marines stationed at the main gate. He uses his Devil Fruit powers and creative tactics to overwhelm the guards, demonstrating his determination to rescue Robin. His relentless assault creates chaos among the Marine forces.
events.significance: This marks the beginning of one of the most significant rescue missions in One Piece. Luffy's solo charge demonstrates his unwavering commitment to saving his crewmate and sets the tone for the entire Enies Lobby assault. His actions inspire his allies and show the World Government that the Straw Hats will go to any lengths to protect their nakama.

events.title: Luffy's Marine Puppet Technique
events.description: Luffy demonstrates creative use of his Gomu Gomu powers by grabbing a Marine soldier and wrapping his stretchy limbs around him, using the unfortunate Marine as a human puppet to fight against his own comrades. This unconventional tactic allows Luffy to confuse and defeat multiple Marines simultaneously.
events.significance: This moment showcases Luffy's growing tactical creativity in combat, possibly influenced by Usopp's clever fighting style. It demonstrates that Luffy is not just powerful but increasingly resourceful, using his Devil Fruit abilities in unexpected ways to gain advantages in battle.

events.title: Spandam Receives Intelligence on the Invasion
events.description: CP9 leader Spandam is informed by his subordinates that intruders have entered Enies Lobby and are causing significant casualties among the Marine forces. Despite his shock at the invasion, Spandam demonstrates strategic thinking by recognizing that the reputation of Enies Lobby as an impregnable fortress is crucial to the World Government's authority.
events.significance: This scene establishes Spandam's awareness of the institutional importance of Enies Lobby. While he may appear arrogant and cruel, he understands that any successful invasion would damage the World Government's image of invincibility. This adds depth to the stakes of the conflict beyond just rescuing Robin.

events.title: Franky Family and Galley-La Company Arrive at the Main Gate
events.description: The Franky Family, led by Zambai and the Kairiki Destroyers, along with Galley-La Company shipwrights Paulie and Tilestone, arrive at Enies Lobby's main gate to support the rescue mission. Despite being civilians and shipwrights rather than professional fighters, they charge into battle to help save Robin and confront the World Government.
events.significance: This demonstrates the wide-reaching impact of Robin's situation and the bonds she formed in Water 7. Former enemies (Franky Family) and allies (Galley-La) unite for a common cause, showing that Robin's worth extends beyond just the Straw Hat crew. Their participation elevates the conflict from a pirate crew vs. government battle to a broader statement about justice and friendship.

events.title: Paulie's Rope Action: Figure of Eight Knot
events.description: Paulie demonstrates his signature Rope Action fighting style by using the Figure of Eight Knot technique to restrain and take down a group of Marines. His expertise with rigging and knots, honed through years of shipwright work, proves highly effective in combat as he binds multiple enemies simultaneously.
events.significance: This showcases how Paulie's professional skills as a shipwright translate into combat effectiveness. It reinforces the theme that diverse talents and backgrounds can be valuable in battle, and demonstrates Paulie's commitment to helping save Robin despite his initial suspicions about pirates.

events.title: Zambai's Cannon and Tilestone's Bear Hug Assault
events.description: Zambai uses his mounted cannon to blast through groups of Marines, while Tilestone employs his massive strength to bear-hug and crush enemy soldiers. The Franky Family and Galley-La members work together to clear a path through the Marine defenses at the main gate.
events.significance: This demonstrates the diverse fighting styles and capabilities of the allied forces. Each member contributes their unique skills to the assault, showing that the rescue mission has united people with different backgrounds and abilities for a common cause.

events.title: Mozu and Kiwi Pick the Gate Locks
events.description: The Square Sisters, Mozu and Kiwi, use their swords to skillfully pick the locks on the massive doors of Enies Lobby's main gate. Once unlocked, the Kairiki Destroyers push open the enormous doors, allowing the allied forces to advance deeper into the government facility.
events.significance: This demonstrates the strategic planning and coordination of the assault force. Rather than relying solely on brute force, they employ a combination of skills—lockpicking and strength—to overcome obstacles, showing the intelligence behind their rescue operation.

events.title: Kashii and Oimo's Debut as Enies Lobby's Giant Gatekeepers
events.description: Two massive giants, Kashii and Oimo, appear before the invading forces as the official gatekeepers of Enies Lobby. Standing over 50 feet tall, these formidable guardians have protected the government facility for 50 years. They mock the comparatively tiny invaders and prepare to defend the gates, presenting an overwhelming obstacle to the rescue mission.
events.significance: The introduction of Kashii and Oimo raises the stakes dramatically, as giants are known to possess enormous strength capable of easily defeating normal-sized humans. Their presence demonstrates the World Government's resources and the true difficulty of the rescue mission. This is also significant as it introduces two former members of the Giant Warrior Pirates who were deceived by the government.

events.title: Kashii and Oimo's 50-Year Service Revealed
events.description: It is revealed that Kashii and Oimo have been guarding Enies Lobby's main gate for 50 years. They explain that they were captured by the Marines and agreed to serve as gatekeepers for 100 years in exchange for the World Government's promise to release their former captains, Dorry and Brogy, who they believed were imprisoned in Impel Down.
events.significance: This revelation exposes the World Government's willingness to use deception and manipulation to gain loyal servants. The giants' tragic story—believing they are serving to free their beloved captains while actually being exploited—adds moral complexity to the conflict and foreshadows a potential turning point when they learn the truth about Dorry and Brogy.

events.title: Kairiki Destroyers Challenge the Giants
events.description: The Kairiki Destroyers—Dago, Ottoland, and Footbianco—step forward to fight Kashii and Oimo. As the three largest members of the Franky Family, they are confident they can match the giants. However, despite their impressive size by human standards (reaching up to the giants' knees), they are completely outmatched by the true giants' strength.
events.significance: This confrontation demonstrates the enormous power gap between even the largest humans and true giants. The Kairiki Destroyers' defeat establishes Kashii and Oimo as formidable obstacles that will require more than just strength to overcome, setting up the need for a strategic solution rather than a direct battle.

events.title: Kairiki Destroyers Effortlessly Defeated by the Giants
events.description: Kashii and Oimo easily defeat the Kairiki Destroyers with minimal effort, tossing them aside despite their attempts to use their combined strength. The rest of the Franky Family watches in shock and horror as their strongest members are overwhelmed, realizing the true extent of the giants' power.
events.significance: This defeat creates a sense of urgency and desperation among the allied forces. It demonstrates that brute strength alone won't be enough to overcome the obstacles at Enies Lobby, and suggests that clever tactics or alternative approaches will be necessary to succeed in the rescue mission.

events.title: Sodom and Gomorrah Join the Battle
events.description: The King Bulls Sodom and Gomorrah, massive aquatic creatures raised by the Franky Family, arrive at the battlefield. With assistance from Paulie, Zambai, Mozu, and Kiwi, they manage to tackle and bring down Kashii, one of the two giant gatekeepers, demonstrating that teamwork and strategy can overcome even the most formidable opponents.
events.significance: This moment shows that victory against overwhelming odds is possible through cooperation and using all available resources. The successful takedown of Kashii provides hope to the allied forces and demonstrates that the Franky Family's unique assets (like their King Bulls) can make a real difference in the battle. It also shows Paulie and the Franky Family members working together seamlessly.

themes.description: The episode explores how far people will go for their friends and loved ones. The Franky Family and Galley-La shipwrights risk their lives to rescue Robin, while Kashii and Oimo have served for 50 years believing they are helping their captains.
themes.symbolism: The contrast between the invaders' genuine bonds of friendship and the giants' manipulated loyalty highlights the difference between true devotion and exploitation.

themes.description: The World Government's deception of Kashii and Oimo demonstrates their willingness to exploit others' loyalty and emotions for their own purposes. The giants believe they are serving to free their captains, unaware that Dorry and Brogy were never imprisoned.
themes.symbolism: The gates that Kashii and Oimo guard represent not just physical barriers but also the walls of lies that keep them imprisoned in service to the government.

themes.description: Former enemies and allies with different backgrounds—pirates, shipwrights, and dismantlers—work together toward a common goal. Each contributes their unique skills, from Paulie's rope work to the Franky Family's King Bulls.
themes.symbolism: The combined assault on Enies Lobby symbolizes how diverse groups can accomplish more together than any single faction could alone.

themes.description: The episode emphasizes the theme of smaller, determined individuals facing overwhelming odds. Whether it's Luffy against thousands of Marines or the Franky Family against giant gatekeepers, the heroes refuse to be intimidated by superior numbers or size.
themes.symbolism: The giants Kashii and Oimo literally represent insurmountable obstacles, but the heroes' creativity and teamwork show that size and power aren't everything.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy demonstrates his unwavering determination to rescue Robin by charging into Enies Lobby alone against thousands of enemies. His creative use of the Marine puppet technique shows his growing tactical awareness while maintaining his straightforward, fearless approach to combat.
keyActions: Charges into Enies Lobby solo, overwhelming Marines at the main gate
Uses creative Marine puppet technique to confuse and defeat enemies
Springs over the main gate using his Gomu Gomu powers

characterSpotlights.development: Kashii is introduced as one of Enies Lobby's fearsome giant guardians. His backstory reveals a tragic figure who has been serving the World Government for 50 years under false pretenses, believing he is helping to free his beloved captains Dorry and Brogy.
keyActions: Makes his first appearance as Enies Lobby's gatekeeper
Reveals his 50-year service and the false promise that binds him
Easily defeats the Kairiki Destroyers, demonstrating his immense power
Is eventually taken down by the combined efforts of Sodom, Gomorrah, and the allied forces

characterSpotlights.development: Oimo debuts alongside Kashii as the second giant guardian of Enies Lobby. Like his companion, he has been deceived by the World Government into serving for 50 years, believing it will lead to the release of his former captains. His loyalty and dedication are admirable, even though they are based on lies.
keyActions: Makes his first appearance as Enies Lobby's gatekeeper alongside Kashii
Reveals the deceptive deal that has kept him in service for 50 years
Mocks and easily defeats the Kairiki Destroyers

characterSpotlights.role: Galley-La representative in the rescue mission
characterSpotlights.development: Paulie demonstrates his commitment to justice and friendship by joining the assault on Enies Lobby despite being a shipwright rather than a fighter. His Rope Action techniques prove effective in combat, and he works seamlessly with former rivals like the Franky Family.
keyActions: Uses Rope Action: Figure of Eight Knot to restrain Marines
Assists in taking down the giant Kashii alongside Zambai, Mozu, and Kiwi
Demonstrates leadership among the Galley-La forces

characterSpotlights.role: Franky Family leader in the assault
characterSpotlights.development: Zambai leads the Franky Family in their assault on Enies Lobby, demonstrating courage and tactical thinking. He uses his cannon to clear Marines and works with others to help defeat Kashii, showing the Franky Family's determination to rescue Robin.
keyActions: Leads the Franky Family through the main gate
Uses his cannon to blast through Marine forces
Assists in taking down Kashii with Paulie, Mozu, and Kiwi

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended the battle sequences at the main gate with additional action and combat choreography not present in the manga.
The anime added more detailed animation of Luffy's Marine puppet technique, showing the comedic aspects of Marines fighting their own comrade.

trivia.fact: This episode adapts manga chapters 376-378, covering the beginning of the assault on Enies Lobby's main gate.

Kashii and Oimo are named after the biblical cities of Sodom and Gomorrah, which were destroyed by divine judgment. This naming connects to their role as guardians at a place of judgment (Judicial Island).
Kashii stands at 1700 cm (55'9") and Oimo at 1600 cm (52'6"), making them smaller than the giants Dorry and Brogy from Little Garden, who stand at around 2200 cm (72'2").
The episode title 'Luffy Cuts Through' (快進撃 - Kaishingeki) can also be translated as 'Luffy's Rapid Progress' or 'Luffy's Swift Advance,' emphasizing his unstoppable momentum.
This episode marks the debut of Kashii and Oimo, who later become allies of the Straw Hats after learning the truth about Dorry and Brogy in the following episodes.
The Kairiki Destroyers are so large for humans that they reach up to the giants' legs, yet they are still no match for true giants in combat.
Sodom and Gomorrah, the King Bulls, are the highest grade of their species and were raised by the Franky Family to reach their massive size.
